New Ways To Sequester Carbon Despite Retreat From Climate Change Action
- Apr 2, 2025 7:12 pm GMT
Rapid decarbonization is the purpose of the burgeoning carbon capture industry. Companies are looking at how to remove mainly CO2 from the air and water. The companies want to make it profitable. Currently, the cost per captured ton of CO2 is prohibitive. To invent cheaper solutions, universities are coming to the rescue, where academics are looking to mimic natural processes and use commonly found materials that have high adsorbent CO2 properties.
New Ways To Sequester Carbon Despite Retreat From Climate Change Action
Carbon capture is an offshoot of the energy industry and manufacturing. Rapid decarbonization has produced many potential business models but the cost per ton of captured CO2 remains prohibitive. Researchers at Stanford and Ben Gurion Universities, however, have each come up with low-cost CCS solutions that emulate and accelerate natural weathering processes.
